page.title: 01South West Allendale
page.content: Three valleys with spurs of the north Pennines between, form the head of the west Allendale; Whitewalls Burn, wellhope Burn and the west Allen itself flowing through the valleys. Spartywell and limestone brae, by the west Allen, are scattered settlements, and the valleys and low fells abound in small farms, some used as farms, some as cottages, and some disused. There is much evidence of old leadmining. Sheep graze on the fells, cattle and sheep in the valleys. The haughs are also cropped for hay.
